intro: Heracleum arcticum, commonly known as Arctic cowparsnip, is a flowering plant native to Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It produces a distinctive, hollow stem that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height.
